subject: Re: [junit] JUnit 4 & Eclipse & BeforeClass [SOLVED]
msgSnippet: ... Of course, @BeforeClass methods should be defined in Suite class, NOT in my abstract class. -- View this message in context:
messageBody:
bpuzon wrote:
>
> All my tests are derived from an abstract class with @BeforeClass. And
> @BeforeClass is still being run more than once for testing process :/ (I'm
> asking Eclipse to run MasterTest()).
>

Of course, @BeforeClass methods should be defined in Suite class, NOT in my
abstract class.

--
View this message in context: http://www.nabble.com/JUnit-4---Eclipse---BeforeClass-tf4553813.html#a13062700
Sent from the JUnit - User mailing list archive at Nabble.com.
